TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CCLayerColor extends Cocos2D.CCLayerRGBA implements class Cocos2D.ICCBlendProtocol

Docs.summary: <para> <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLayerColor" /> is a subclass of <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLayer" /> that implements the <ref refid="classcocos2d_1_1_r_g_b_a_protocol" kindref="compound">RGBAProtocol</ref> protocol. </para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLayerColor" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLayer" /><ref refid="classcocos2d_1_1_r_g_b_a_protocol" kindref="compound">RGBAProtocol</ref>
Docs.remarks: <para>All features from <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLayer" /> are valid, plus the following new features:<list type="bullet"><item><description>opacity</description></item><item><description>RGB colors </description></item></list></para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLayer" /><list type="bullet"> <item> <description>opacity</description> </item> <item> <description>RGB colors </description> </item> </list><para>opacity</para><para>RGB colors </para>

Docs.summary: Sets the untransformed size of the node.
Docs.remarks: <para>Sets the untransformed size of the node.</para><para>The contentSize remains the same no matter the node is scaled or rotated. All nodes has a size. <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLayer" /> and <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCScene" /> has the same size of the screen.</para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLayer" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCScene" /><para /><parameterlist kind="param"> <parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>contentSize</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>The untransformed size of the node. </para> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> </parameterlist><parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>contentSize</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>The untransformed size of the node. </para> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem><parameternamelist> <parametername>contentSize</parametername> </parameternamelist><parametername>contentSize</parametername><parameterdescription> <para>The untransformed size of the node. </para> </parameterdescription><para>The untransformed size of the node. </para>

MemberSignature.Value: public override void Draw ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void Draw() cil managed

Docs.summary: Override this method to draw your own node. The following GL states will be enabled by default:glEnableClientState(GL_VERTEX_ARRAY);glEnableClientState(GL_COLOR_ARRAY);glEnableClientState(GL_TEXTURE_COORD_ARRAY);glEnable(GL_TEXTURE_2D); AND YOU SHOULD NOT DISABLE THEM AFTER DRAWING YOUR NODE But if you enable any other GL state, you should disable it after drawing your node.
Docs.remarks: <para>Override this method to draw your own node. The following GL states will be enabled by default:<list type="bullet"><item><description>glEnableClientState(GL_VERTEX_ARRAY);</description></item><item><description>glEnableClientState(GL_COLOR_ARRAY);</description></item><item><description>glEnableClientState(GL_TEXTURE_COORD_ARRAY);</description></item><item><description>glEnable(GL_TEXTURE_2D); AND YOU SHOULD NOT DISABLE THEM AFTER DRAWING YOUR NODE But if you enable any other GL state, you should disable it after drawing your node. </description></item></list></para><list type="bullet"> <item> <description>glEnableClientState(GL_VERTEX_ARRAY);</description> </item> <item> <description>glEnableClientState(GL_COLOR_ARRAY);</description> </item> <item> <description>glEnableClientState(GL_TEXTURE_COORD_ARRAY);</description> </item> <item> <description>glEnable(GL_TEXTURE_2D); AND YOU SHOULD NOT DISABLE THEM AFTER DRAWING YOUR NODE But if you enable any other GL state, you should disable it after drawing your node. </description> </item> </list><para>glEnableClientState(GL_VERTEX_ARRAY);</para><para>glEnableClientState(GL_COLOR_ARRAY);</para><para>glEnableClientState(GL_TEXTURE_COORD_ARRAY);</para><para>glEnable(GL_TEXTURE_2D); AND YOU SHOULD NOT DISABLE THEM AFTER DRAWING YOUR NODE But if you enable any other GL state, you should disable it after drawing your node. </para>
